reviews.review_msg: Crim 432 online with her was the worst class ever. We had two thirty page papers one for the first 6 weeks and one for the last 6 weeks. It was horrible. The exams were 5 essay questions and the questions were obscure, not at all the repeated themes in the course. Would not recommend unless you want to waste your time.

Joan Brockman (professor) and Sarah Yercich (TM) are a powerful team! Great class, amazing support, all around positive experience. Would recommend as long as Sarah is your TM... this class would have been a lot more difficult without her support and guidance.

Expect to have a lot of reading for this class. There are two 8,000+ assignments due, along with a mid-term and the final. The material is very dry and repetitive and if you want a good grade prepare to write a paper every week. If you need to take a crim course for credits, I suggest you take a different one.

Lots of writing required but there's no exams. Class is mostly based on student presentations and lots of interaction. Course material was very interesting to read and discuss. If you like to talk take this course, but if you're a quiet person don't take it. Joan's an easy marker.
